description: L4 비즈니스 마스터리 2차 - 이메일/보고서/고객서비스 (기존 문법 + 비즈니스 확장)

stages.title: 이메일 요청 및 정중 표현
stages.intent: 비즈니스 이메일에서 정중하고 명확한 요청을 하며 수신자를 배려하는 언어를 사용한다.
lexset: request, appreciate, grateful, urgent, deadline, attachment, confirm, follow-up, regarding, kindly

seeds.en: Could you please check the attached file?

seeds.kr: 회의 일정을 조정해야 할 것 같습니다.
seeds.en: The meeting schedule would need to be adjusted.
The deadline has been extended.
Your prompt response would be greatly appreciated.
I would like to discuss this matter.
Additional information is required.
I will be waiting for your reply.
Please refer to my previous email.
I would like to inform you that the situation has changed.
I would appreciate your cooperation.

stages.title: 이메일 감사 및 확인
stages.intent: 비즈니스 이메일에서 받은 도움에 감사를 표하고 내용을 정확히 확인한다.
lexset: thank, appreciate, grateful, acknowledge, confirm, understand, clarify, received, noted, assistance

seeds.en: I greatly appreciate your assistance.
I have received your email.
I have confirmed what you mentioned.
Thank you for your prompt response.
I would like to confirm that I have understood correctly.
I have reviewed your proposal.
Thank you for clarifying that.
All details have been confirmed.
I appreciate you taking the time.
The information you requested has been prepared.

stages.title: 보고서 데이터 분석 및 해석
stages.intent: 비즈니스 보고서에서 데이터를 객관적으로 분석하고 전문적으로 해석을 제시한다.
lexset: analysis, data, statistics, trend, increase, decrease, correlation, significant, indicate, demonstrate

seeds.en: The analysis shows that sales have increased.
The data indicates a clear trend.
These factors have influenced the results.
Significant improvement has been observed.
Statistics demonstrate the following pattern.
Growth has been achieved compared to the previous quarter.
The research findings support the hypothesis.
Market share has been expanded.
These indicators prove the success.
The prediction model has been confirmed to be accurate.

stages.title: 보고서 권고사항 및 실행계획 (Bridge)
stages.intent: 보고서의 분석을 바탕으로 구체적이고 실행 가능한 권고사항과 계획을 제시한다.
lexset: recommend, suggest, implement, strategy, plan, execute, prioritize, allocate, timeline, objective

seeds.en: I recommend implementing the following strategy.
We should proceed with prioritized actions.

seeds.kr: 이 계획이 실행되면 성과가 향상될 것입니다.
seeds.en: If this plan is implemented, performance will improve.
Resources must be allocated efficiently.
I suggest a phased implementation timeline.
These are key actions for achieving objectives.
We should proceed while minimizing risks.
Setting success metrics is crucial.

seeds.kr: 이 접근법이 최적의 결과를 가져올 것입니다.
seeds.en: This approach will bring optimal results.
I present immediately actionable solutions.

stages.title: 고객 문의 응답 및 안내
stages.intent: 고객의 문의에 정확하고 친절하게 답변하며 필요한 정보를 체계적으로 안내한다.
lexset: inquiry, information, assist, provide, explain, guide, available, service, procedure, requirement

seeds.en: Thank you for your inquiry.
I will be happy to assist you.
I can provide the information you requested.
The procedure is as follows.
Please contact us if you need further assistance.
I will explain the service in detail.
I have reviewed all available options.
I understand your requirements.
I suggest the best solution.
You can contact us at any time.

stages.title: 불만 처리 및 해결 방안
stages.intent: 고객의 불만을 진정성 있게 수용하고 구체적인 해결 방안을 제시한다.
lexset: complaint, concern, apologize, understand, resolve, solution, improve, compensate, ensure, prevent

seeds.en: I sincerely apologize for the inconvenience caused.
I understand your concerns.
I will resolve this issue immediately.
We will provide appropriate compensation.
We will ensure this doesn't happen again.
Your feedback helps us improve.
I will find a satisfactory solution.
We will thoroughly investigate the situation.
We want to restore your trust.
We will provide improved service.

stages.title: 서비스 업그레이드 및 제안
stages.intent: 고객의 니즈를 파악하여 적합한 서비스 업그레이드나 추가 제안을 한다.
lexset: upgrade, enhance, benefit, advantage, feature, option, customize, premium, value, investment

seeds.kr: 더 나은 서비스로 업그레이드하시는 것은 어떨까요?
seeds.en: How about upgrading to a better service?

seeds.kr: 이 기능이 많은 도움이 될 것입니다.
seeds.en: This feature will be very helpful.

seeds.kr: 귀하의 필요에 맞게 맞춤화할 수 있습니다.
seeds.en: We can customize it to your needs.
Let me explain the advantages of the premium option.

seeds.kr: 투자 대비 높은 가치를 얻으실 수 있습니다.
seeds.en: You can get high value for your investment.
This upgrade will improve efficiency.
We offer special discount benefits.
This is a solution optimized for your business.
You can secure a competitive advantage.
You can save costs in the long term.

stages.title: 서비스 종료 및 관계 유지
stages.intent: 서비스 종료 시에도 긍정적인 관계를 유지하고 향후 기회를 열어둔다.
lexset: complete, finish, satisfaction, experience, future, opportunity, contact, reference, recommend, pleasure

seeds.en: The service has been successfully completed.
I hope you were satisfied.
Please contact us again anytime.
We would like to maintain a good relationship.
We would appreciate your recommendation.
Was your service experience good?

seeds.kr: 향후 기회가 있다면 함께 일하고 싶습니다.
seeds.en: We would like to work together if there are future opportunities.
Your feedback would be helpful.
It has been a pleasure working with you.
We will help you whenever you need it.

stages.title: 팀 협업 및 역할 분담
stages.intent: 팀 프로젝트에서 효과적인 협업을 위해 역할을 분담하고 커뮤니케이션을 조율한다.
lexset: collaborate, coordinate, assign, responsibility, delegate, teamwork, support, contribute, communicate, organize

seeds.en: Let's collaborate to complete the project.
We need to clarify each person's role.
Who should we assign this task to?
Teamwork is the key to success.
We should work by supporting each other.
All team members can contribute.
Regular communication is important.
We have distributed tasks efficiently.
We should utilize each person's strengths.
Let's work to achieve team goals.

stages.title: 성과 평가 및 피드백
stages.intent: 팀원들의 성과를 객관적으로 평가하고 건설적인 피드백을 제공한다.
lexset: evaluate, assess, performance, feedback, improve, strength, weakness, achievement, progress, development

seeds.en: You have shown good performance overall.

seeds.kr: 이 부분을 개선하면 더 좋을 것 같습니다.
seeds.en: It would be better if this part could be improved.
I highly appreciate your efforts.
You have succeeded in achieving the goal.
Continuous development is needed.
Please demonstrate your strengths even more.
Please accept the feedback constructively.

seeds.kr: 다음 분기에는 더 나은 결과를 기대합니다.
seeds.en: I expect better results next quarter.
You have made a great contribution to the team.
Let's create an improvement plan together.

stages.title: 변화 관리 및 적응
stages.intent: 조직의 변화를 효과적으로 관리하고 팀원들의 적응을 돕는다.
lexset: change, adapt, transition, adjust, flexible, support, challenge, opportunity, innovation, transform

seeds.en: It's important to adapt to change.
We will transition to a new system.
We need to respond with flexibility.
Let's accept change as an opportunity.
We will provide support during the adaptation process.
We can develop through innovation.
Let's grow by overcoming challenges.
A change management plan is needed.
We will introduce changes gradually.
All team members need to participate in the change.

stages.title: 프로젝트 완료 및 성과 공유 (Bridge)
stages.intent: 프로젝트 완료 시 성과를 체계적으로 정리하고 팀원들과 성취를 공유한다.
lexset: complete, accomplish, achieve, success, milestone, celebrate, learn, experience, knowledge, share

seeds.en: We have successfully completed the project.
We have achieved all our goals.
We celebrate the team's hard work.
We have reached an important milestone.
We have learned a lot from this experience.
We want to share the achievements with all team members.
We have obtained excellent results.
Knowledge and experience have been accumulated.
We will utilize this achievement in the next project.
We appreciate all team members' contributions.
